sentences: 'Hoiab oma pojukest nagu mädamuna 'õrnalt, nii et katki ei läheks'.
Purunenud mädamuna vastik lehk ja ta hoiab oma pojukest õrnalt, nii et katki ei läheks.
context: The word 'läheks' is the conditional form of the verb 'läheb' (from 'lähema' - to go/break). In this context, it's used in a negative construction meaning 'should not break' or 'won't break'. The phrase 'nii et katki ei läheks' means 'so that it doesn't break'. This appears to be describing how someone handles something fragile carefully so it won't break.
